description:
As you solve LeetCode questions, you can mark them as hard, medium, or easy. The tool will then recommend questions you should review based on (1) how hard the question was for you and (2) how much time has passed since you last reviewed it. I'd recommend normally attempting LeetCode problems and just marking them as hard, medium, or easy for you at first so the tool knows which problems to recommend you review!

Here's the theory behind spaced repetition and learning if interested: https://www.codecademy.com/article/spaced-repetition

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=40173237

Points: 14

description:
Hi HN, I’ve launched the website for my upcoming side business - a little Windows desktop application that I developed to scratch a personal itch. This is a significant milestone for me as it's both my first ever website and side business.

The website itself is built using Tailwind CSS with plain JavaScript and some PHP scripts to handle the sign-up forms. I used a lot of ChatGPT for all of it. It's hosted on the the Hetzner level 1 webhosting plan costing EUR 1.90 per month and put behind Cloudflare. I am actually quite curious how this setting will hold up against the traffic from this post.

You can check out the website here: [https://www.iconpainter.io]. Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thanks a lot!

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=40168292

Points: 2
